constituent: fall, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, each, walking legs, mouth
heisigStory: When water falls, it splats and splashes; when flower petals fall, they float gently in the breeze. To each thing its own way of falling.
koohiiStory1: Water each flower or the petals will wither and fall.
koohiiStory2: [It´s been suggested on the forum (http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?id=1079) that flower across the full width of the kanji and water on the left below it should have its own keyword; seaweed is a popular choice. See also dilute (#227), clan (#1912), seaweed (#2035). This story is for the benefit of those using that idea.] Picture a group of Japanese skydivers falling through the sky -- suddenly each one opens, instead of a parachute, an enormous sheet of nori seaweed to carry them safely down.
myStory: chữ lạc. rụng, Rơi xuống. mỗi giọi nước rơi xuống bãi cỏ
readingExamples: 落ちる (お.ちる), 落とす (お.とす)
words: smartly dressed, someone smartly dressed, fashion-conscious
to fall into, to feel down (sad)
fallen leaves, leaf litter, defoliation, shedding leaves
to joke, to play on words, to dress stylishly
to overlook, to fail to notice
calm down, settle in, be steady
failure, dropping out of a class
